outputs.output_descr:
UNDP has provided livelihood assistance to the Tunisian governorates which border on Libya. The livelihoods program focuses on labor-intensive activities addressing infrastructure priorities, providing employment to the most affected and economically vulnerable populations. The program also works to strengthen local governance and strengthening local emerging civil society organizational participation and contribution to social cohesion capacities. By the end of 2011, the main results were: 
•	500 short-term jobs had been created in a southern governorate on the Tunisia-Libya border that benefitted most affected men, women and youth, and the program is ongoing in 2012. 
•	Environmental and economical burden related to the hosting of over 50000 Libyans fleeing combats, alleviated through labor-intensive works. The action also permitted the establishment of healthy dialogue between beneficiary community and local authority. 
•	Organizational and programmatic capacities of over 30 emerging civil society organizations, including youth and women CSO, from affected governorates, built. Enhanced participation of trained CSO in public debates reported. The action also permitted tighter collaboration and networking of beneficiary CSO 
•	Strong partnership with main regional and local stakeholders established and permitted sound advocacy of decentralization and region-based planning and interventions. 


UNDP will contributed US$310,000 from TRAC 1 Resources.  Japan government through Japan non-core funding contributed with US$2,300,000.

project_descr: To reduce the rapidly increasing economic burden and growing social tension on the Tunisian communities living in the areas bordering with Libya.
project_title: Appui aux Communautés Frontalières à la Libye
